required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open Label Study Using OsteoProbe System
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Arm, Open Label Clinical Study to Collect Safety Data on the Osteoprobe System When Used as a Measurement Tool

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, Single Center, Open Label Clinical Study. The purpose of the study is to collect safety data associated with the use of the OsteoProbe System. Study Duration is expected to take approximately 3 months from first subject enrolled to the last follow-up visit.

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Reported Device Related Serious Adverse Events.
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced device-related serious adverse events (SAEs) in subjects evaluated with the OsteoProbe System, per potential risks in the protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Reported Device Related Serious Adverse Events.
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of device-related serious adverse events (SAEs) in subjects evaluated with the OsteoProbe System.

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Reported Device Related Serious Adverse Events.
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of device-related serious adverse events (SAEs) in subjects evaluated with the OsteoProbe System.

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Reported Device Related Serious Adverse Events.
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced device-related serious adverse events (SAEs) in subjects evaluated with the OsteoProbe System, per potential risks in the protocol.

secondary_outcome.description: The Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) is a continuous scale comprised of a line, with an eleven point numeric range (0 to 10) anchored by 2 verbal descriptors, one for each symptom extreme. The 0 mark corresponds to 'no pain', while the 10 mark corresponds to 'worse pain possible'. Therefore, higher scores indicate greater pain intensity. At all follow-up time points (post-procedure, Day 1, Day 7 , and Day 30), average was taken compared to baseline (Pre-Procedure).
BSMi Score is an output measure by the OsteoProbe device to measure bone tissue's resistance to microindentation which can be positively correlated with bone tissue quality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced an adverse event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Device-related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced an device-related adverse event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced a Serious adverse event.
The number of participants who experienced a Unanticipated adverse device effects.

clinical_study.condition: Adverse Effects in the Use of the OsteoProbe System

intervention.description: The OsteoProbeÂ® System ("OsteoProbe") is a bone microindentation measurement tool. The device is a measurement tool that is not intended to make a diagnosis or provide a treatment decision. There are no other available measurement tools for clinical assessment of bone's resistance to microindentation.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

outcome.title: NRS Pain Scores
outcome.description: The Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) is a continuous scale comprised of a line, with an eleven point numeric range (0 to 10) anchored by 2 verbal descriptors, one for each symptom extreme. The 0 mark corresponds to 'no pain', while the 10 mark corresponds to 'worse pain possible'. Therefore, higher scores indicate greater pain intensity. At all follow-up time points (post-procedure, Day 1, Day 7 , and Day 30), average was taken compared to baseline (Pre-Procedure).

group.title: OsteoProbe System
group.description: OsteoProbe System: The OsteoProbeÂ® System ("OsteoProbe") is a bone microindentation measurement tool. The device is a measurement tool that is not intended to make a diagnosis or provide a treatment decision. There are no other available measurement tools for clinical assessment of bone's resistance to microindentation.

measure.title: NRS Pain Scores

The 0 mark corresponds to 'no pain', while the 10 mark corresponds to 'worse pain possible'. Therefore, higher scores indicate greater pain intensity. At all follow-up time points (post-procedure, Day 1, Day 7 , and Day 30), average was taken compared to baseline (Pre-Procedure).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
